npcs.name: Algan Tinmizer
utterances: Greetings!  Looking for a bashcogglinator or perhaps a metefozic thermogauge?
Oh my, it does indeed!  I thought I'd lost those parts.  You've saved me a great deal of trouble, friend.  Let me compensate you for your keen eyes and good nature.

I see my superior intellect confuses you.  Don't worry, it perplexes many people - tis' the curse of the Tinmizer name.  However, I can use your help, for even simple minds contribute to the greatness of Qeynos.
You must venture into the Forest Ruins. Tavern tales claim the remnants of the magi tower of the Order of Three exist there. You must reveal the truth of this mystery.
Good! I can't wait to hear about it!
This is wonderful news!  Someday, I must explore the ruins but not today.  I thank you for your service, adventurer.

npcs.name: Arbuthnot Jumroller
utterances: Well, then, what can I do for you?
Magical shield? Is that what they were designing? I thought it was a new brewery system! Hah! Imagine that! Ha! Um, yeah.

Towser didn't tell me at first what he was working on, no.  If you ask me, though, whatever Towser designed should have been good enough for the committee.  I don't know what Magus Weskah was thinking!
I asked him a few times, but he was very closed about it.  He takes a lot of pride in his discretion.  Since he lost the competition, he's been a little bitter.  That won't affect his work, though.

There isn't anything Towser can't do once he's put his mind to it.  He's been a bit down lately since Magus Weskah over in North Qeynos picked someone else's design, but I'm sure he'll pull through things just fine.  Are you a friend of his, too?
I can't say much about the contest since I didn't enter it myself.  In fact, without that truth potion, Jo Ironshield gave him, Towser wouldn't have said a word about it!  He hates to lose, you see!

Jo slipped him some at the pub. It was funny at the time, though his wife didn't think so.  All I know is that poor Towser couldn't stop telling the truth about things, even that ugly hat of hers! The Qeynos North Alchemists' Guild that Jo belongs to won't be so amused either, I guess.
Good old Towser! I'm glad to see you're becoming friends with him, too.  Especially after all he's been through! Let me see...yes, yes...

Not too long at all, friend!  Towser seems to lose keys every other day.  He's a great guy, but I'm constantly having to make new keys for him.  He must have a lock on every door and drawer in his house! Heh!
There you go, right as rain!
Tell Towser that me and the missus hope he and the family can join us for supper again sometime soon.

npcs.name: Barmaid Estella Muddyfoot
utterances: Fresh baubbleberry pie, come and get some while it's hot!

npcs.name: Byrtle Bobblepeg
utterances: Welcome! What can I help you with?

npcs.name: Diggin Diggs
utterances: You're looking a might shabby there.  You could use some fine armor from Diggs' inventory.  I carry only the finest quality and sell at outrageously low, low prices!  I live for the community.
So, you're a worker with no task, eh?  If you're itchin' to fill your pockets with heavy coin, then I have a task for you.  Are you interested in hunting?
Then prepare for a hunting trip in the Forest Ruins.  I'll pay you handsomely for a bundle of badger pelts.  I may even toss in a bit of Diggs' finest armor.
Try to make them high quality pelts!
Fine work ... fine work!  I must tell you, I just paid my merchant taxes.  'Fraid the coin ain't as heavy as I promised.  Sorry, taxes you know?  I speak the truth!

npcs.name: Drizzcopper
utterances: The answer to your question is no. I'm afraid we don't extend lines of credit at this time.

npcs.name: Innkeeper Millbanks
utterances: Welcome to the Inn, adventurer.  You look absolutely exhausted. Here, let us take your things!

npcs.name: Marshal Surefoot
utterances: Stand stout! You'd make a fine deputy.
Aha!  A mercenary!  I can use your mettle for testing the strengths of the enemy.  Can you overcome the titans of the forest?  What do ya say, soldier?
Then stand firm and venture to the Forest Ruins.  The foes act as Forgotten Guardians.  They prey upon the people ... stand tall, soldier!  Crush a few and return with a tale of victory!
Good! Return when you've bested them.
What bravery!  You laughed in the face of death! You are a true protector of the forest realms.  I shall seek you out when I recruit my force of Leatherfoot deputies.  You are relieved for now.

npcs.name: Peona Toughins
utterances: Your garb looks a might worn.  Can I interest you in a fine new set of armor?
You can never be too careful when it comes to protecting yourself. Why not try something new?
Hello there!  Can I interest you in some of the finest merchandise this side of Norrath?

npcs.name: Sage Xoort
utterances: Hello there!  How can I be of service?
Nothing much, just a schematic I'm working on.  I can't find a power source for it ... Oh, Solusek's flame! How in the name of Brell can I make this thing work?

Fire's no good. It doesn't get hot enough or burn long enough.  WAIT!  HAH! Oh, you're right! I need a special type of coal.  You thought of it, so you can fetch it. I need still-burning embers from the forgotten guardians in the Forest Ruins.
Well?  What are you waiting for?  Go, go, GO!
So, you return with the coals ... I hope you didn't get burned! Let me take a look...

Oh yes! These shall work nicely!  Tell you what -- take this money for your work. I planned on buying a spell for creating a power source but because of your smart thinking and hard work, I need no spell!

npcs.name: Smithy Findlebop
utterances: Never go into battle without a tried and trusted weapon. Take a look at what we have in stock.
Welcome to my humble shop.  We have quite a selection of weapons to choose from.  See for yourself...

npcs.name: Tapster Bregun
utterances: What can I get for ya?

npcs.name: Tawli Whiskwind
utterances: Good day to you, deary!  I make the most wonderful brooms--strong bristles, stout handles, and quite stylish if you ask me.  Great for sweeping off your doorstep or scaring off little critters!
Well, if anyone can wear out a broom, it's Vida. She sweeps so much you could eat off her spotless floor! Here's her new broom. I hope she uses it well.

npcs.name: Wazzleburn
utterances: Blast it! Who keeps taking all of the parchment?
All right where is my pen?  How am I supposed to scribe anything without my pen?
